title: Liberty's new Floribunda homeware collection puts a cool, modern spin on traditional floral prints
text:
Step into the third-floor interiors emporium at Liberty from today and you’ll find a welcome respite from the autumnal chill outside: a maximalist display of rather unseasonal but undeniably uplifting spring flowers.

Floribunda, the brand’s aptly named latest homeware collection, sees prints from its fabric archive splashed over textiles, tableware, lighting and accessories, created by 12 specially selected independent designers and homeware brands.

Bryony Sheridan, Liberty’s homeware buyer, came up with the concept for the collection only a couple of months ago, and called on the help of a few designers whose work the shop already stocks, such as Matilda Goad, who has contributed scalloped lampshades lined with printed fabric, and Lisa Mehydene of homeware brand Edit58, who has created floral cushions with frilled gingham trims.
